Joseph and I talked a bit on this group about
implementing NEAT with indirect encoding, taking a
modular approach.  And I know Ken has lots of thoughts
on "second-generation NEAT", using a genome that
doesn't necessarily just map genes one-to-one with
explicit features of a neural network, but perhaps
where a single gene encodes for larger structures, or
defines growth or unfolding rules, or some other form
of indirect encoding.

I was wondering if anyone else here had thought much
about this subject or given a shot at implementing
them.

Derek
